bill_title: to require that a State Child Health Plan be developed.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to require that a State Child Health Plan be developed. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. The secretary of the Department of Social Services shall develop a State Child Health Plan based on the requirements of Public Law 105-33 which established Subtitle J, the State's Children's Health Insurance Program. The plan shall be submitted to the Secretary of Health and Human Services of the United States for approval prior to the deadline to ensure access to federal assistance. 750 copies of this document were printed by the South Dakota Legislative Research Council at a cost of $.016 per page. . Insertions into existing statutes are indicated by underscores. Deletions from existing statutes are indicated by overstrikes.
